title: Admin and finance intern Interview
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward interview with task, which was to complete a planning document for an upcoming trip. Around 1 hour in total. No travel costs paid, despite it being an internship. Panel was friendly and welcoming.

title: Marketing Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UNHCR
Interview Descriptions: Overall a very pleasant experience. It was a remote interview in which I was interviewed by three people through a Zoom call, and the questions were fairly simple - mostly to confirm what I had written on the application form.
Interview Questions: Q: Please introduce yourself in the space of 3 minutes.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNHCR
Interview Descriptions:
Straight forward, behavioural questions with current interns and their manager
With a basic excel test afterwards, filling in with formulas. The job does require a bit of basic excel so make sure to freshen yours up
Interview Questions: Why do you want this role

title: Administrative & Finance Interview
Interview Descriptions:
One hour test (completing a travel itinerary for a member of staff) followed by a one hour interview with a panel of three people. It was a fairly standard interview experience.
However, I was disappointed by the whole system. 6 month unpaid internship in London, weren't willing to pay travel expenses to the interview, say that you can't get a job in 6 months after internship (although have seen that people have). Unpaid internships, especially full time and in London, are exploitative and favour those who are rich.
Wasn't given the job due to being 'too experienced' which I was grateful for in the end, as no idea how I would have afforded it!
Interview Questions: About my understanding of the UNHCR

title: External Relations Intern Interview
Interview Descriptions: The External Relations Officer and outgoing intern video interviewed me online to ascertain my reasons for applying and to hear any questions I had about the role's duties and responsibilities.
Interview Questions: why are you appluing for this role?

title: Senior Communications Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at UNHCR in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: Submit application, shortlisting (took around 3 months), then invite to a 90 minute written skills test. This was followed a month later by a 30-minute panel interview (online) with competency-based questions, as well as a 'why do you want this job' opening question. There was time to ask a question at the end.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for UNHCR, and specifically, in this job? Competency questions about managing external stakeholders, planning and organising, teamwork, addressing challenges and failures, trends and outlook in the area of humanitarian action and forced displacement.

title: JPO Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNHCR
Interview Descriptions: I applied for a JPO position at the UNHCR. I was invited for a competency based interview that was conducted via video chat and lasted less than 30 min in total.  It being so short, I felt like I did not get a decent opportunity to show my competency.
Interview Questions: Referring to the terms of reference (job description), and based on your past experience, why are you the best candidate for this role?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UNHCR
Interview Descriptions:
Made an application through email and they replied back with an interview invitation (took them around 4 weeks). The interview consisted of an exam on a laptop and the initial interview 
The exam was difficult.

title: Goodwill Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNHCR
Interview Descriptions: There was an activity you had to complete on the laptop once you arrived at their office. It included creating a tweet, doing an E-tray exercise and pitching a person of your choice to be a  new goodwill ambassador. There was a formal interview with 2 or 3 team members.
Interview Questions: Do you know any of the goodwill ambassadors?

title: Investigator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at UNHCR (Edinburgh, Scotland) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Applied in person - application form. Then shortlisted for interview. Interview consisted of 6 competency questions by 2 interviewers, followed by a written assessment. Written assessment was a case study to identify the different complaints a person had about legal service he was provided, then identify what further information you needed to clarify the complaints. 

Interviewers were friendly. 45 minutes interview, 30 minute assessment.
Interview Questions:
Assessment- case study- identify issues complained of, identify what further infromation you need to confirm nature of complaint
Interveiw: 6 questions:
1. Example of when you analysed information and wrote a report - and tecnhiques you used
2. Describe a time when you brought 2 people together (mediation)
3. Describe a time when you had to take on a change in work - how did you respond...
4. Desctibe a time when you implemented a system and the outcome

title: PR & Social Media, Goodwill Ambassador Team Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNHCR (London, England)
Interview Descriptions: There was a panel interview comprising two current interns, the head of department, and the intern coordinator. The day before I was set a written assessment regarding their social media accounts that was submitted online.
Interview Questions: Have you used social media analysis tools before

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UNHCR (London, England) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: They were very friendly and welcoming, there were 3 interviewers who asked me 10 questions and then there was time for me to ask questions about the position. The whole thing took 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you displayed management skills

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UNHCR (London, England) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and did an at home examination, then an hour telephone interview. I spoke first to two interns and I was encouraged to ask questions and chat to them about the position. At the interview stage there were three interviewers and they asked the usual questions and were open to questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here and not some other refugee organization?
